law.catch_line: Criminal possession of destructive device or booby trap device.
law.text:
A person is guilty of criminal possession of a destructive device or a booby trap device when he possesses, manufactures, or transports such substance or device with:
Intent to use that device to commit an offense against the laws of this state, a political subdivision thereof, or of the United States; or
Knowledge that some other person intends to use that device to commit an offense against the laws of this state, a political subdivision thereof, or of the United States.
Mere possession without substantial evidence of the requisite intent is insufficient to bring action under KRS 237.030 to 237.050.
